content: 5 © 2022 maddy moe afterthought heel method using a smooth waste yarn of a different color knit the first 28 32 36 sts half of the total sts cut your waste yarn slip these sts back to your left needle and you will continue working the rest of the sock in your main color yarn only you did not change the bor position you just worked half a row in another color and slid the sts back to the existing bor you do not need to cut your main color yarn as you work you may notice a small gap where the waste yarn was joined and cut but we will resolve this later knit until your sock is about 2 shorter than the end of your toes then work the toe decreases as follows toe/heel decreases round 1 *k1 ssk k 22 26 30 k2tog k1* twice round 8 knit round 2 knit round 9 *k1 ssk k 14 18 22 k2tog k1* twice round 3 *k1 ssk k 20 24 28 k2tog k1* twice round 10 knit round 4 knit round 11 *k1 ssk k 12 16 20 k2tog k1* twice round 5 *k1 ssk k 18 22 26 k2tog k1* twice round 12 *k1 ssk k 10 14 18 k2tog k1* twice round 6 knit round 13 *k1 ssk k 8 12 16 k2tog k1* twice round 7 *k1 ssk k 16 20 24 k2tog k1* twice round 14 *k1 ssk k 6 10 14 k2tog k1* twice you should have 20 28 36 sts remaining use the kitchener stitch to join the two halves of your sock worked over two sets of 10 14 18 sts refer to the helpful methods section on page 2 for a recommended video on this method you now have a finished sock at this point your sock s heel looks like the image on the left with the heel unworked using your size us 2 needles with the rs facing you and starting from either end of the waste yarn pick up 28 32 36 sts from one side pick up one additional stitch to fill the gap pick up the other 28 32 36 sts and pick up one additional stitch to fill the gap remove the waste yarn being careful that nothing unravels setup round *k 27 31 35 sts k2tog* twice you have 56 64 72 sts remaining work the toe/heel decreases section above as you worked for the toes and you will end with the same number of sts as before join the two halves using the kitchener stitch as before and you have a finished sock work second sock to match weave in all ends block your socks and let them dry hanging on sock blockers and enjoy thank you for supporting my work pattern support feel free to reach out to me with any questions about my patterns i m happy to help ravelry moemr social media want to see sneak
